nodes.name: FH
nodes.description: Represents biallelic inactivation of FH (loss of FH function).

nodes.name: αKG-dependent dioxygenase inhibition
nodes.description: Fumarate competitively inhibits αKG-dependent dioxygenases.

nodes.name: HIF prolyl hydroxylase (PHD) inhibition
nodes.description: Inhibition of PHD enzymes that normally hydroxylate HIFα for degradation.

nodes.name: HIF stabilization
nodes.description: HIFα is stabilized (impaired degradation) in normoxia due to PHD inhibition.

nodes.name: Pseudohypoxia
nodes.description: Hypoxia-like transcriptional activity activated despite in normoxia.

nodes.name: TET/KDM demethylase inhibition
nodes.description: Inhibition of TET DNA demethylases and Jumonji KDM histone demethylases.

nodes.name: Global DNA hypermethylation
nodes.description: Genome-wide increase in DNA methylation due to impaired demethylation.

nodes.name: CpG island methylator phenotype (CIMP)
nodes.description: Hypermethylated epigenome state characteristic of FH/SDH oncometabolite tumors.

nodes.name: Mitochondrial damage
nodes.description: Mitochondrial dysfunction/damage associated with FH loss, fumarate, and ROS.

nodes.name: Mitochondrial DNA leakage to cytosol
nodes.description: Release of mitochondrial DNA into the cytosol under mitochondrial stress.

nodes.name: cGAS-STING innate immune sensing
nodes.description: Cytosolic DNA sensing pathway that can induce interferon signaling.

nodes.name: Chronic interferon signaling
nodes.description: Sustained interferon response that may promote immune dysfunction/exhaustion.

nodes.name: Immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment (TME)
nodes.description: Microenvironment with reduced effective cytotoxic anti-tumor immunity.

nodes.name: Antioxidant defenses
nodes.description: Cellular antioxidant programs (e.g., glutathione, detox enzymes) downstream of NRF2.

nodes.name: Angiogenesis program
nodes.description: Angiogenic transcriptional program downstream of HIF (e.g., VEGF).

nodes.name: Tumor vascularity
nodes.description: High vascularity tumor phenotype.

nodes.name: Immune evasion program
nodes.description: Composite immune evasion state (simplified placeholder).

nodes.name: Reduced antigen presentation
nodes.description: Lowered antigen presentation.

nodes.name: Cancer state
nodes.description: Probabilistic terminal state representing malignant cancer transformation/progression.

nodes.name: Genomic instability / chromosomal instability
nodes.description: Genome-wide instability; high fraction genome altered and aneuploidy.

nodes.name: NF2
nodes.description: Tumor suppressor; loss can dysregulate Hippo signaling and growth control.

nodes.name: Hippo signaling pathway
nodes.description: Growth control pathway; dysregulation can promote proliferation/survival.

nodes.name: Receptor tyrosine kinase (RTK) signaling
nodes.description: RTK signaling; Includes MET/EGFR/others.

nodes.name: PI3K–AKT–mTOR signaling
nodes.description: Growth and survival signaling; often downstream of RTKs.

nodes.name: Proliferation/survival program
nodes.description: Generic growth/survival output program (placeholder).

nodes.name: Growth factor signaling context
nodes.description: Generic pro-growth signaling (placeholder).

edges.subject: gene:FH
edges.mechanism: loss of FH activity blocks fumarate to malate, leading to fumarate accumulation
edges.notes: Represents effect of FH loss rather than normal FH enzymatic activity.

edges.subject: process:tca_cycle_blockade
edges.mechanism: fumarate accumulates upstream of FH blockade

edges.subject: metabolite:fumarate
edges.mechanism: succination of cysteine residues (2SC adducts)

edges.subject: process:protein_succination
edges.mechanism: KEAP1 succination impairs NRF2 degradation

edges.subject: protein:KEAP1
edges.mechanism: KEAP1 targets NRF2 for degradation (baseline regulation)

edges.subject: protein:NRF2
edges.mechanism: NRF2 transcriptional activation of antioxidant response genes

edges.subject: state:oxidative_stress
edges.mechanism: oxidative stress can impair KEAP1-mediated NRF2 degradation, increasing NRF2-ARE activity.
edges.notes: Stress context may increase reliance on NRF2; directionality is conceptual.

edges.subject: metabolite:fumarate
edges.mechanism: competitive inhibition of αKG-dependent dioxygenases by fumarate

edges.subject: process:akg_dioxygenase_inhibition
edges.mechanism: PHDs are a subset of αKG-dependent dioxygenases

edges.subject: process:PHD_inhibition
edges.mechanism: reduced hydroxylation reduces HIFα degradation

edges.subject: state:HIF_stabilization
edges.mechanism: stabilized HIF activates hypoxia-response transcription in normoxia

edges.subject: process:akg_dioxygenase_inhibition
edges.mechanism: TET/KDM enzymes are αKG-dependent dioxygenases inhibited by fumarate

edges.subject: process:TET_KDM_inhibition
edges.mechanism: impaired demethylation shifts epigenome toward hypermethylation

edges.subject: process:DNA_hypermethylation
edges.mechanism: global hypermethylation manifests as CpG island methylator phenotype

edges.subject: metabolite:fumarate
edges.mechanism: redox imbalance and succination-associated stress under FH loss
edges.notes: Simplified: ROS/oxidative stress is context-dependent and may vary by model.

edges.subject: state:oxidative_stress
edges.mechanism: ROS can damage mitochondrial membranes and genomes
edges.notes: Mechanistic direction is plausible but not asserted as universal.

edges.subject: process:mitochondrial_damage
edges.mechanism: mitochondrial stress can lead to mtDNA release into cytosol

edges.subject: process:mtDNA_leakage
edges.mechanism: cytosolic DNA engages innate immune sensing

edges.subject: pathway:cGAS_STING
edges.mechanism: persistent sensing may drive sustained interferon response
edges.notes: Chronicity is context-dependent; encoded as uncertain.

edges.subject: process:chronic_interferon_signaling
edges.mechanism: chronic inflammation can contribute to immune dysfunction/exhaustion
edges.notes: Directionality reflects a conceptual model; not a clinical claim.

edges.subject: pathway:NRF2_ARE
edges.mechanism: NRF2 transcriptional program increases antioxidant capacity

edges.subject: process:antioxidant_defense
edges.mechanism: antioxidant programs reduce ROS burden
edges.notes: Negative feedback; simplifies dose/timing.

edges.subject: state:pseudohypoxia
edges.mechanism: HIF activation induces angiogenic factors such as VEGF

edges.subject: process:angiogenesis_program
edges.mechanism: angiogenic signaling increases tumor vascularity

edges.subject: phenotype:tumor_vascularity
edges.mechanism: aberrant vasculature can contribute to immune dysfunction and exclusion
edges.notes: Simplified: vascularity→immune suppression is context-dependent.

edges.subject: phenotype:CIMP
edges.mechanism: epigenetic silencing may reduce antigen presentation machinery (simplified)
edges.notes: Placeholder mechanism; revise when adding specific genes/processes.

edges.subject: process:antigen_presentation_down
edges.mechanism: reduced antigen presentation facilitates immune evasion

edges.subject: process:immune_evasion_program
edges.mechanism: immune evasion contributes to immunosuppressive microenvironment

edges.subject: phenotype:immunosuppressive_TME
edges.mechanism: immune suppression may permit tumor outgrowth and progression
edges.notes: Facilitator edge; not a deterministic claim.

edges.subject: phenotype:CIMP
edges.mechanism: epigenetic reprogramming may increase evolutionary plasticity / malignant potential
edges.notes: Encodes 'necessary vs sufficient' uncertainty.

edges.subject: state:pseudohypoxia
edges.mechanism: pseudohypoxia supports survival, angiogenesis, and growth programs
edges.notes: Facilitator edge.

edges.subject: pathway:NRF2_ARE
edges.mechanism: antioxidant adaptation can enable survival under metabolic stress
edges.notes: Not claiming NRF2 is an oncogene here; survival-enabling framing.

edges.subject: phenotype:CIMP
edges.mechanism: epigenetic silencing of repair programs may increase instability (placeholder)
edges.notes: Placeholder until specific repair processes/genes are encoded.

edges.subject: process:genomic_instability
edges.mechanism: genomic instability can accelerate acquisition of malignant capabilities
edges.notes: Facilitator edge.

edges.subject: gene:NF2
edges.mechanism: placeholder: NF2 loss can dysregulate Hippo/YAP/TAZ signaling (direction simplified)
edges.notes: This edge is intentionally uncertain; revise with explicit YAP/TAZ nodes later.

edges.subject: pathway:Hippo
edges.mechanism: Hippo dysregulation may promote growth/survival outputs
edges.notes: Placeholder; clarify directionality when adding YAP/TAZ.

edges.subject: pathway:RTK_signaling
edges.mechanism: RTKs can activate PI3K/AKT/mTOR signaling

edges.subject: pathway:PI3K_AKT_mTOR
edges.mechanism: growth/survival signaling supports proliferation under stress
edges.notes: Generic; not asserting universal activation in FHRCC.

edges.subject: process:proliferation_survival_program
edges.mechanism: proliferation/survival outputs facilitate malignant progression
edges.notes: Facilitator edge.

edges.subject: phenotype:CIMP
edges.mechanism: placeholder: epigenetic rewiring may indirectly enable growth signaling programs
edges.notes: Weak/placeholder; revise once specific RTKs (e.g., MET) are added.

edges.subject: state:pseudohypoxia
edges.mechanism: hypoxia-like programs can reshape growth factor and stromal signaling context
edges.notes: Placeholder bridge; revise with specific factors if desired.

edges.subject: process:growth_factor_signaling_context
edges.mechanism: pro-growth context can increase RTK pathway activity
edges.notes: Non-specific by design.

edges.subject: pathway:PI3K_AKT_mTOR
edges.mechanism: growth signaling activates downstream proliferation/survival outputs
edges.notes: Switches from enables→activates to reduce predicate penalty but remains hypothesis.
